ecstasy.definition: An overwhelming feeling of great happiness or joyful excitement
examples: You should have seen her ecstasy, and how he caught it for having stayed away so long
Without a word, he lifted her into his arms and carried her to the world of ecstasy they called their bedroom

empower.definition: Give (someone) the authority or power to do something
examples: Well, we are going to empower people and give them better information
We need to empower staff, give them accountability

ethical.definition: Relating to moral principles or the branch of knowledge dealing with these
examples: The correspondence took an ethical tone
The correspondence took an ethical tone
The competition was very equitable since both teams were the same age and skill level
It removed all disfranchisement, and embraced equitable amnesty and exemption features
Late claims will only be accepted in exceptional circumstances
He knows there is someone or something out there that has weird and exceptional abilities
